1.text: “At this my heart also pounds and leaps from its place.

2.text: Listen closely to the thunder of His voice and the rumbling that comes from His mouth.

3.text: He unleashes His lightning beneath the whole sky and sends it to the ends of the earth.

4.text: Then there comes a roaring sound; He thunders with His majestic voice. He does not restrain the lightning when His voice resounds.

5.text: God thunders wondrously with His voice; He does great things we cannot comprehend.

6.text: For He says to the snow, ‘Fall on the earth,’ and to the gentle rain, ‘Pour out a mighty downpour.’

7.text: He seals up the hand of every man, so that all men may know His work.

8.text: The wild animals enter their lairs; they settle down in their dens.

9.text: The tempest comes from its chamber, and the cold from the driving north winds.

10.text: By the breath of God the ice is formed and the watery expanses are frozen.

11.text: He loads the clouds with moisture; He scatters His lightning through them.

12.text: They swirl about, whirling at His direction, accomplishing all that He commands over the face of all the earth.

13.text: Whether for punishment or for His land, He accomplishes this in His loving devotion.

14.text: Listen to this, O Job; stand still and consider the wonders of God.

15.text: Do you know how God dispatches the clouds or makes the lightning flash?

16.text: Do you understand how the clouds float, those wonders of Him who is perfect in knowledge?

17.text: You whose clothes get hot when the land lies hushed under the south wind,

18.text: can you, like Him, spread out the skies, as strong as a mirror of bronze?

19.text: Teach us what we should say to Him; we cannot draw up our case because of our darkness.

20.text: Should He be told that I want to speak? Would a man ask to be swallowed up?

21.text: Now no one can gaze at the sun when it is bright in the skies after the wind has swept them clean.

22.text: Out of the north He comes in golden splendor; awesome majesty surrounds Him.

23.text: The Almighty is beyond our reach; He is exalted in power! In His justice and great righteousness He does not oppress.

24.text: Therefore, men fear Him, for He is not partial to the wise in heart.”
